content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-056-07-B |Item_parent=The disabled child: guidance and care (see items 118, 121) |Item_parent_short=The disabled child: orientation and care (see items 118, 121) |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the main situations of disability in children in France |Description=Main causes of disability in children |Rubric=Epidemiology |Contributors= |Order=7}} Main types of disability in children= motor/sensory/cognitive/mental/psychic disability ([[Disability status SD-345|Disability status]]). Congenital malformations: 2-3% of children, around 20% with severe disabilities Cerebral palsy: 1rst cause of motor disability (1/1500 births) linked to early cerebral lesions Trisomy 21: 1rst cause of hereditary mental retardation Foetal alcohol syndrome: 1rst cause of non-hereditary mental retardation Dyslexia- dysorthographia: the 1rst cause of specific learning difficulties Multiple disabilities: around 9,000 children in France Acquired disabilities
